WHY IS GARY COMMUNITY SCHOOLS HOLDING A REFERENDUM?

Our Gary Community Schools face a multi-million-dollar deficit, which results in deficit spending. Through cost-saving efforts, the deficit for our Gary Schools decreased from $22 million in August 2017 to $6 million in December 2019. Revenue from the referendum will help ensure that we receive the funding necessary to meet the educational needs of this and future generations. A balanced budget is necessary for ending State control of our Gary Community Schools.

Check out our website for videos and continuously updated information on the Referendum: https://www.garycsc.k12.in.us/referendum/

Did GCSC get $4 million from US Steel?

In August 2019, GCSC received a one-time payment of approximately $4 million from US Steel. This revenue was a one-time, upfront payment on future property tax revenue over 20 years. In exchange for this one-time payment, GCSC will not collect property tax from US Steel over the next 20 years on investments made in Gary. This one-time payment must cover the property tax revenue that will not be collected from US Steel over the next 20 years. While a one-time payment may have a short-term positive impact on a fund balance, the GCSC overall (all funds) budget imbalance is a long-term situation that is not corrected by a one-time payment or receipt of funds.

In an era when e-learning is the new norm, the Gary Community School Corporation is working to provide resources and information to assist parents with technology. The District has teamed up the West Side Leadership Academy PTSA to host a series of virtual workshops where GCSC school parents can ask questions and learn more about the operation of the Chromebooks and hotspots that children grades K-12 received as an enrolled student.

"We recognize that there are varying skill levels among our parents when it comes to technology," said Darrell Riddell, IT Director for the Gary schools. "The IT Department plays a critical role in helping close the digital divide."

The first course takes place Friday, August 21 at 5:30 p.m. and is open to all parents and guardians of the District. The access information is as follows:

Call: 602-580-9678
Access Code: 337725
or use the link below to join virtually
https://join.freeconferencecall.com/wslaptsa

Please send an email to WSLAPTSA@yahoo.com to reserve your spot. Tracy Coleman Larona Ronnie Carter Darrell Riddell

It's so many questions around the Gary Schools Referendum and what it means... we will be posting answers to the frequently asked questions here and on our website.

Why hold the Referendum?
GCSC is running a multi-million-dollar deficit, which means the district is spending more money every year than it is taking in. Since 2017, the deficit has decreased from $22 million to $6 million, as of January 31, 2020. Revenue from the referendum will help eliminate the annual deficit and balance the budget. A balanced budget is necessary for ending State control.

Check out our website for videos and continuously updated information on the Referendum: https://www.garycsc.k12.in.us/referendum/
